topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdf4476368727574391300#post_54bdf4476368727574391300
Oh Christ.

When I had to get the stitches put on my heal to sow it back up as a kid I remember laughing.

I remember thinking "This tickles!" Who ever heard a kid laugh at getting stiches put in and laughing at the fact his entire heal was split open so bad it looked like a hotdogbun?!
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdf4b363687265dc281000#post_54bdf4b363687265dc281000
yeah
that first one i was a kid, i cried hard
but we got it sewed up, and to help numb the pain, i had popsicles

finger situation, i handled it pretty well
fucking hurt, had my finger stiched
and after it got cast, i kept taking the cast off to look at my rotting fingernail
even after the nail fell out, and a new one grew out from underneath the skin
shit was gross
but cool

like seriously it stopped hurting the next day, and everyday i kept taking the cast off to look, because it was just neat
i wish we had taken pictures

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdf48363687228190d1e00#post_54bdf48363687228190d1e00
OWWWWWWWWW!

I remember I did something stupid recently at my old house like a couple of years back. (Probably two)

I was trying to open a can of Beans and split open my thumb.

You see these stupid bean cans have one of those weird Soda can like openers.

And I had a hard time getting it off so a pulled up with EXTREME force and when I opened it I accidently Jabbed my thumb on the sharp edge of the can top and split it open.


"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdf4966368720b15070900#post_54bdf4966368720b15070900
Oooooooooooooh, That sounds fucking awful.

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdf6ad636872406f780700#post_54bdf6ad636872406f780700
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54bdf6ca63687212fab91800#post_54bdf6ca63687212fab91800
I was a stupid kid. I remember one time I was running down the hall and I accidentally kicked a door frame. It hurt a lot, and it continued for about a week. My mom took me to hospital and I had X-Rays done. I had a huuuuuuuuge hair line fracture in my foot. The doc casted me up and I was told to stick to crutches or a wheel chair for about a month and a half. I kept doing wheelies and shit in my wheel chair.
